verses.verse: <S%H480>Woe<s%> is me! for I am as when they have <S%H625>gathered<s%> the summer <S%H7019>fruits<s%>, as the <S%H5955>grapegleanings<s%> of the <S%H1210>vintage<s%>: there is no <S%H811>cluster<s%> to <S%H398>eat<s%>: my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H183>desired<s%> the firstripe <S%H1063>fruit<s%>. when: Heb. the gatherings of summer

The <S%H2623>good<s%> man is <S%H6>perished<s%> out of the <S%H776>earth<s%>: and there is none <S%H3477>upright<s%> among <S%H120>men<s%>: they all lie in <S%H693>wait<s%> for <S%H1818>blood<s%>; they <S%H6679>hunt<s%> every <S%H376>man<s%> his <S%H251>brother<s%> with a <S%H2764>net<s%>. good: or, godly, or, merciful

That they may do <S%H7451>evil<s%> with both <S%H3709>hands<s%> <S%H3190>earnestly<s%>, the <S%H8269>prince<s%> <S%H7592>asketh<s%>, and the <S%H8199>judge<s%> asketh for a <S%H7966>reward<s%>; and the <S%H1419>great<s%> man, he <S%H1696>uttereth<s%> his <S%H1942>mischievous<s%> <S%H5315>desire<s%>: so they wrap it <S%H5686>up<s%>. his: Heb. the mischief of his soul

The <S%H2896>best<s%> of them is as a <S%H2312>brier<s%>: the most <S%H3477>upright<s%> is sharper than a thorn <S%H4534>hedge<s%>: the <S%H3117>day<s%> of thy <S%H6822>watchmen<s%> and thy <S%H6486>visitation<s%> <S%H935>cometh<s%>; now shall be their <S%H3998>perplexity<s%>.

<S%H539>Trust<s%> ye not in a <S%H7453>friend<s%>, put ye not <S%H982>confidence<s%> in a <S%H441>guide<s%>: <S%H8104>keep<s%> the <S%H6607>doors<s%> of thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%> from her that <S%H7901>lieth<s%> in thy <S%H2436>bosom<s%>.

For the <S%H1121>son<s%> <S%H5034>dishonoureth<s%> the <S%H1>father<s%>, the <S%H1323>daughter<s%> riseth <S%H6965>up<s%> against her <S%H517>mother<s%>, the daughter in <S%H3618>law<s%> against her mother in <S%H2545>law<s%>; a <S%H376>man's<s%> <S%H341>enemies<s%> are the <S%H582>men<s%> of his own <S%H1004>house<s%>.
Therefore I will <S%H6822>look<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; I will <S%H3176>wait<s%> for the <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H3468>salvation<s%>: my <S%H430>God<s%> will <S%H8085>hear<s%> me.

<S%H8055>Rejoice<s%> not against me, O mine <S%H341>enemy<s%>: when I <S%H5307>fall<s%>, I shall <S%H6965>arise<s%>; when I <S%H3427>sit<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness<s%>, the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall be a <S%H216>light<s%> unto me.

I will <S%H5375>bear<s%> the <S%H2197>indignation<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, because I have <S%H2398>sinned<s%> against him, until he <S%H7378>plead<s%> my <S%H7379>cause<s%>, and <S%H6213>execute<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%> for me: he will bring me <S%H3318>forth<s%> to the <S%H216>light<s%>, and I shall <S%H7200>behold<s%> his <S%H6666>righteousness<s%>.

Then she that is mine <S%H341>enemy<s%> shall <S%H7200>see<s%> it, and <S%H955>shame<s%> shall <S%H3680>cover<s%> her which <S%H559>said<s%> unto me, Where is the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>? mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> shall <S%H7200>behold<s%> her: now shall she be trodden <S%H4823>down<s%> as the <S%H2916>mire<s%> of the <S%H2351>streets<s%>. Then: or, And thou wilt see her that is mine enemy, and cover her with shame shall she: Heb. she shall be for a treading down
In the <S%H3117>day<s%> that thy <S%H1447>walls<s%> are to be <S%H1129>built<s%>, in that <S%H3117>day<s%> shall the <S%H2706>decree<s%> be far <S%H7368>removed<s%>.

In that <S%H3117>day<s%> also he shall <S%H935>come<s%> even to thee from <S%H804>Assyria<s%>, and from the <S%H4693>fortified<s%> <S%H5892>cities<s%>, and from the <S%H4693>fortress<s%> even to the <S%H5104>river<s%>, and from <S%H3220>sea<s%> to <S%H3220>sea<s%>, and from <S%H2022>mountain<s%> to <S%H2022>mountain<s%>. and fromcities: or, even tocities

Notwithstanding the <S%H776>land<s%> shall be <S%H8077>desolate<s%> because of them that <S%H3427>dwell<s%> therein, for the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> of their <S%H4611>doings<s%>. Notwithstanding: or, After that it hath been

<S%H7462>Feed<s%> thy <S%H5971>people<s%> with thy <S%H7626>rod<s%>, the <S%H6629>flock<s%> of thine <S%H5159>heritage<s%>, which <S%H7931>dwell<s%> <S%H910>solitarily<s%> in the <S%H3293>wood<s%>, in the <S%H8432>midst<s%> of <S%H3760>Carmel<s%>: let them <S%H7462>feed<s%> in <S%H1316>Bashan<s%> and <S%H1568>Gilead<s%>, as in the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H5769>old<s%>. Feed: or, Rule
According to the <S%H3117>days<s%> of thy <S%H3318>coming<s%> out of the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%> will I <S%H7200>shew<s%> unto him <S%H6381>marvellous<s%> things.

The <S%H1471>nations<s%> shall <S%H7200>see<s%> and be <S%H954>confounded<s%> at all their <S%H1369>might<s%>: they shall <S%H7760>lay<s%> their <S%H3027>hand<s%> upon their <S%H6310>mouth<s%>, their <S%H241>ears<s%> shall be <S%H2790>deaf<s%>.

They shall <S%H3897>lick<s%> the <S%H6083>dust<s%> like a <S%H5175>serpent<s%>, they shall <S%H7264>move<s%> out of their <S%H4526>holes<s%> like <S%H2119>worms<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>: they shall be <S%H6342>afraid<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> our <S%H430>God<s%>, and shall <S%H3372>fear<s%> because of thee. worms: or, creeping things

Who is a <S%H410>God<s%> like unto thee, that <S%H5375>pardoneth<s%> <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>, and passeth <S%H5674>by<s%> the <S%H6588>transgression<s%> of the <S%H7611>remnant<s%> of his <S%H5159>heritage<s%>? he <S%H2388>retaineth<s%> not his <S%H639>anger<s%> for <S%H5703>ever<s%>, because he <S%H2654>delighteth<s%> in <S%H2617>mercy<s%>.

He will turn <S%H7725>again<s%>, he will have <S%H7355>compassion<s%> upon us; he will <S%H3533>subdue<s%> our <S%H5771>iniquities<s%>; and thou wilt <S%H7993>cast<s%> all their <S%H2403>sins<s%> into the <S%H4688>depths<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea<s%>.

Thou wilt <S%H5414>perform<s%> the <S%H571>truth<s%> to <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>, and the <S%H2617>mercy<s%> to <S%H85>Abraham<s%>, which thou hast <S%H7650>sworn<s%> unto our <S%H1>fathers<s%> from the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H6924>old<s%>.
